meanings.definition: A genus of yeast fungi commonly used in baking and brewing.
meanings.sent1: Saccharomyces is often found in bread dough to help it rise.
meanings.sent2: Brewers rely on saccharomyces to ferment sugars into alcohol.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous saccharomyces decided to throw a party in the bakery.
meanings.sent4: The power of saccharomyces in baking is like a tiny wizard creating magic in the oven.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread is thanks to the hard work of saccharomyces.

meanings.definition: Any of various yeasts of the genus Saccharomyces, used in brewing and baking.
meanings.sent1: In brewing, different strains of saccharomyces can create unique flavors in beer.
meanings.sent2: Bakers carefully select the type of saccharomyces to achieve the desired texture in their bread.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous saccharomyces yeast went on a quest to find the perfect dough.
meanings.sent4: The impact of saccharomyces on brewing is like a conductor leading a symphony of flavors.
meanings.sent5: The dance of saccharomyces with sugar transforms the dough into a delicious loaf of bread.
